critique: This document pertains to a specific provision in the Emergency Appropriation Act of 1935, addressing the re-employment of individuals previously working in the Prohibition Bureau or Alcoholic Beverage Unit. It directs the Civil Service Commission to waive age limits for these individuals when taking civil service examinations for re-employment. The document appears neutral in terms of ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, and social inclusion. It primarily focuses on procedural aspects of re-employment within the government following the repeal of Prohibition.
